data.meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).
data.sentence: The word ذِكْرٌ comes from the root ذ ك ر and is associated with the meanings: to remember/commemorate/recollect, study in order to remember, remind, bear in mind, mindful, mention/tell/relate, magnify/praise, admonish/warn (e.g. dhikra is the 2nd declenation and it is stronger than dhikr), preach, extol, give status.nobility/eminence/honour, fame, good report, cause of good reputation, means of exaltation.Male/man/masculine (dhakar, dual - dhakarain, plural - dhukur).

data.meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.
data.sentence: The word عَلَّمْنَاهُ comes from the root ع ل م and is associated with the meanings: to mark/sign/distinguish, creations/beings, world, science/learning/knowledge/information, aware/know. By means of which one knows a thing, hence it signifies world or creation, because by it the Creator is known. alim (pl. ulama) - one who is learned/wise or knows.

data.sentence: The word يَنْبَغِي comes from the root ب غ ي and is associated with the meanings: Sought for or after, desired, endeavored to find and take and get (good or evil)Loving or affecting a thingActing wrongfully, injuriously or tyrannicallySeeking or endeavoring to act corruptingly, wrongly and/or unjustly, insolent/disobedientExceeding due bounds or just limits in any wayNot right, proper or fitProstitute or adulteress, unchaste [e.g. 19:20, 19:28, 24:33]Not seeking what one should not seekSeeking game or preyPlace where a thing is sought, way or manner in which a thing is sought

data.meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.
data.sentence: The word الشِّعْرَ comes from the root ش ع ر and is associated with the meanings: to know/perceive/understand, to acquaint, perceive by senses.. make verses, remark, poetry, poet, verse, art of poetry, feeling, knowledge.. Sirius, which was worshipped by the Arabs in Pagan times.. mark/marker/signs/rites/symbols/observances/ceremonies/practices, the obligatory ordinances/statutes of God.. a place where a thing is known to be.. measure of length.. sheep/goat.. hair, innermost garment.. trees.. a sign of people in war and in a journey, a call or cry by means of which to know another, banner.. mash'ar al-Haram - holy mosque in Muadhalifah (a place which lies between Makkah and Arafat, six miles from Kabah). The name Mash'ar al-Haram is a compound of Mash'ar meaning the place of perception or knowledge and Haram meaning sacred. Ash'ara to make anyone understand, make known to.

data.sentence: The word وَقُرْءَانٌ comes from the root ق ر ا and is associated with the meanings: to recite/read, compilation, collection, reading, recitation, explanation, study, investigation.
